TopicTitle: What did you do in KSP1 today?

Articles.Content: Parking is a little tight on the new station. I'm not sure this is going to work...

I launched a 1.4 million kerbuck rocket on a direct ascent to plock. It's completely untested and uses many new parts like the nuclear reactor powering it. What could possibly go wrong?

Thats 13 SpaceY Ratites on the 7.5m first stage(2200KN each). Including the ion engines on the payload, total dV is over 33km/s. Probably overkill.

I'm preparing a new mobile base design for dispatch to Dres. The large ore tanks in the "pontoons" are there to provide more weight so it will drive better in a low gravity environment. The RCS tanks and hitchhiker containers are there because the contract wants more crew capacity and RCS fuel.

Completed another mission on the Mun with my unmanned science hopper:

 

I generally suck at building planes, but, this one that I threw together rather quickly in my newer career save has actually worked out quite well.  This here is version 3.0.  First version had very basic elevons that would not provide enough lift to get the craft off the ground.  Once it hit the end of the runway, the small incline the runway sits on had enough to get it airborne and to altitude. v1 also tended to have the nose want to sink below the horizon at speed.  Version 2 updated the elevons to bigger ones after some tech tree upgrades, and version 3 moved from a single tail fin in front of the center engines, to dual tail fins mounted on each of the wing engines.

 

For the first time ever, I managed to visit the poles of Kerbin. Had always tried with crappy planes before and got tired of waiting.  Here, I kicked in all 4 afterburners to get a nice headstart:

Jeb checks out the South Pole while the batteries charge and the bay doors open to show the science equipment:

 

Next up in this career save is to get ready for a manned Mun mission and manned Minmus mission. Instead of building my normal type of lander, which can land on a moon/planet, then have enough dV left to return home to Kerbin, I think I'm going to go for a smaller lander that will need to redock with an orbiting ship for the return home.  Would also like to get a good, dependable rover on the surface for Jeb and friends to ride around the moons.

Started a new Science career today, since sandbox mode was providing no rewards for the work. And I decided this would be THE career... The career where mistakes mean death, and failures cannot be erased..... This career would define who I was!! THE PRESSURE IS INTENSE!!! IT'S ALMOST TOO MUCH TO HANDLE!!! YOU CAN CUT THE TENSION WITH A KNIFE!!!  .... EHEM.... Valentina died within 10 minutes...

Can I go back to reverts now?

But, made it to space today!

Jeb cares not about things.

 

Jeb better have brought some snacks cuz Jeb now has to walk home.

Revised launch of my orbital fuel depot. It now features slightly more protruded standard docking ports to add a touch more space to squeeze craft into place in and around the ports.

4 hours ago, Lisias said:

While diagnosing and (trying to) fixing a problem on a Mod, I ended up trashing a lot of Missions I did (under Contract Configurator). Since I already had set back my savegame  due involuntary cheating (I forgot a cheat activated testing another problem), I didn't bored to try to restore it from a backup.

However, I also ended up with a hand full of Tourists that just don't go away! (leftovers from the vanished missions).

Since I vowed not to kill a single Kerbal on this savegame, I think I will torture them for some time before dismissing them - I vowed not to kill, and that's all I vowed to. .

So I took my X-3 Mach3 plane, shoved some cabins on it and put some (Screaming) Tourist to fly over Mach 2 at 5 meters high. I'm pretty sure they realized pretty fast the reason the vomit bags were replaced by diapers on the emergency kit…. 

2.5Gs of acceleration on a straight line:

and almost 11Gs on turning.

Boy, I'm happy now.  

— — — — 

But since we are already here, and also due that vanishing missions accident, I'm redoing my CC missions again - what's being interesting (and funny) with the current know-how. This is my (re)flight of Tito's Tourism, my Space Tourism kick off rocket. 100% recoverable - if you manage to get the thing in orbit (really hard, as I don't eject absolutely nothing, not even the escape tower - that is used to help on the deorbit burn, so tight is my fuel profile!). This baby had 140tons at launch, and now with tanks near depleted, she's weighting about 35 tons.

Tito wants a 4 hours flight, so I'll probably will scare the "paper" out of him only tomorrow morning. 3:-)

Hey what mods is your cockpit on X-3-PAX  sorry if you said it

Edited September 1, 2018 by LushChicken

Today I downloaded Scatterer, because I finally own a computer that can run it.

And I discovered that there's an option to make everything wireframe:

So this is how I'm playing KSP from now on
Redesigned a booster and packaged it beautifully inside of a fairing. Time to lift.

4 hours ago, CatastrophicFailure said:

Altho... @JadeOfMaar does have some pretty big SABRE-type engines, I wonder if...

 

Ahhhhh, crap.   

You better do something with the new SCIMITAR 2.5m jet engine I put in there. Based on the real concept, it's even more advanced than SSTO engines and appears after them in the CTT. It's not meant to help you go to space but it'll push further than a Whiplash cluster, with efficiency near that of a Dry Panther.

Spoiler

While I'm in this thread....

I finally launched a warp ship (in sandbox) to Epona, which orbits Grannus, and went about laying flags and footprints via OP VTOL/HOTOL spaceplanes.

I made another Lighthouse
Video

Coming back from a bit of a hiatus, I naturally jumped right into my shuttles, which I'm shocked I remembered how to fly.  So I did some station-y things.

Then I decided to finally go check out a landing strip that's added by one of the mods.  I wanted to take a nuclear electric plane, but I didn't really want to fly there.

Edited September 1, 2018 by Geonovast

3 hours ago, JadeOfMaar said:

You better do something with the new SCIMITAR 2.5m jet engine I put in there.

Skylon!  RULE BRITTANIA!!

All stock (3x Rapiers per SCIMITAR?):

Not my first attempt at Skylon, but this one inspired by JadeOfMaar (= "copycatted from'), now a hero!  Thank you, sir!

I don't usually duplicate craft for missions and already have an efficient 16-pax SSTO (Peregrine), but I think I'll replace the cargo bay in this one with a Mk-3 MP reservoir to take up and replenish space station supplies.

@Geonovast welcome back!  (Missed your slide shows!)

Edited September 1, 2018 by Hotel26

did this today:

Took a good hour or 2 to edit. 57 minutes of footage wrapped up in 3 minutes and 27 seconds. also had to remove about 30 minutes of footage.

Edited September 1, 2018 by mrhexed
info

Submitted an entry to the Dessert Derby 2018

Flew a jet assisted rover from the KSC to the Dessert airfield and then drove it to the Temple complex at high speed, for a time of 8:33.

Some pics of the delivery.

A training mission to the Island Airfield went well, until the hard landing:

Sent an Oryx lander up to rendezvous with the Valentina. This will be used for Minmus expeditions, but we can't leave yet because we need more fuel. I've got another module in the works, a better drive section for the Val that is under construction.

Also sending out rover missions, to build a spaceplane ILS for KSC and gather local science.

I put three flags leading to the runway 10 km apart, with the farthest marked for 1000m altitude and the inner marker 500m. Should help to prevent steep descents and hard turns on final.

Finally, I launched Tito Kerman as the first tourist in this save, aboard the KA-4 Pipistrelle spaceplane.

First attempt required a ascent abort, which worked well although we lost the booster.

The Pipistrelle in orbit, and gliding back to KSC. I messed up the reentry and landed in the desert, but accuracy should improve with experience.
Orbital fuel station fully operational. Money- er, moon trips soon.
Exploring Ceti with a science rover

US Lab Destiny before docking. I know, still no RMS

It was clear that Bill had to try it out... checking the Z1.
